DataElement.preferredDefinition: A response for questions related to premedication regimen(s) to reduce the frequency and/or severity of reactions to imaging contrast agents. The premedication regimen may be dictated by any of the following: research protocol, institution policy, American College of Radiology (ACR), or other governing agencies.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A compound that enables or improves the visualization of body structures or functions for medical imaging._A local or general reaction of an organism following contact with a specific allergen to which it has been previously exposed and to which it has become sensitized._Any relevant actions that were performed or occurred prior to a specific treatment.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A compound that enables or improves the visualization of body structures or functions for medical imaging.

Concepts.definition: A compound that enables or improves the visualization of body structures or functions for medical imaging.

Property.preferredDefinition: A local or general reaction of an organism following contact with a specific allergen to which it has been previously exposed and to which it has become sensitized.:Any relevant actions that were performed or occurred prior to a specific treatment.

Concepts.definition: An immune response that occurs following exposure to an innocuous antigen, but that does not require the presence of preformed antibodies to the antigen.
Any relevant actions that were performed or occurred prior to a specific treatment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Events, people, materials and activities uniquely defined by medical imaging.
ConceptualDomain.origin: DICOM:Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine

ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient unwilling to undergo pre-treatment for contrast media reaction as defined by the institution's policy and/or the ACR

ReferenceDocuments.description: Is the patient able to undergo pre-treatment for contrast media reaction?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ACRIN 6690
ReferenceDocuments.description: If yes, is the participant unwilling to undergo pre-treatment as defined by the institution's  policy and/or ACR guidance?

ReferenceDocuments.name: 4112 Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: If yes, is the participant willing to undergo pre-treatment as defined by the institution's policy and/or ACR guidance?

ReferenceDocuments.name: EA1141 Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has any known allergy-like reaction to gadolinium or moderate or severe allergic reactions to one or more allergens as defined by the American College of Radiology (ACR), is patient willing to undergo pre-treatment as defined by the institution's policy and/or ACR guidance?
